      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that passwords are a minimum of 15 characters in length.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204423r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-010280
      Identities:CCE-27293-0
      V-71935
      SV-86559
      CCI-000205 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (i); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
      Description: The shorter the password, the lower the number of possible combinations that need to be tested before the password is compromised.

      Password complexity, or strength, is a measure of the effectiveness of a password in resisting attempts at guessing and brute-force attacks. Password length is one factor of several that helps to determine strength and how long it takes to crack a password. Use of more characters in a password helps to exponentially increase the time and/or resources required to compromise the password. false
      Fix Text:Configure operating system to enforce a minimum 15-character password length.

      Add the following line to "/etc/security/pwquality.conf" (or modify the line to have the required value):

      minlen = 15
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:476
      Result:false
      Title:Set Password minlen Requirements
      Description:The password minlen should meet minimum requirements
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (check the configuration of /etc/security/pwquality.conf)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (check the configuration of /etc/pam.d/system-auth)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:477 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:check the configuration of /etc/security/pwquality.conf
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2364 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/security/pwquality.conf'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^minlen[\s]*=[\s]*(-?\d+)(?:[\s]|$)'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2365 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', instance must be equal to '1'
      • for check = 'all', subexpression, the following must be true:
        • subexpression must be greater than or equal to '15'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:480 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:check the configuration of /etc/pam.d/system-auth
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2368 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*password\s+(?:(?:required)|(?:requisite))\s+pam_pwquality\.so.*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ not evaluated ]
      • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
      • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
      • filename equals 'system-auth'
      • pattern equals '^\s*password\s+(?:(?:required)|(?:requisite))\s+pam_pwquality\.so.*$'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals ' password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type='
      • line equals ' password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type='
      • subexpression does not exist

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow accounts configured with blank or null passwords.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204424r809187_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-010290
      Identities:CCE-27286-4
      V-71937
      SV-86561
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: If an account has an empty password, anyone could log on and run commands with the privileges of that account. Accounts with empty passwords should never be used in operational environments. false
      Fix Text:If an account is configured for password authentication but does not have an assigned password, it may be possible to log on to the account without authenticating.

      Remove any instances of the "nullok" option in "/etc/pam.d/system-auth" and "/etc/pam.d/password-auth" to prevent logons with empty passwords.

      Note: Manual changes to the listed files may be overwritten by the "authconfig" program. The "authconfig" program should not be used to update the configurations listed in this requirement.
      Severity:high
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1229
      Result:false
      Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow accounts configured with blank or null passwords.
      Description:The file /etc/pam.d/system-auth should not contain the nullok option
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth)
        • false (make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/password-auth)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1230 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2964 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[^#]*\s*nullok\s*'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ not evaluated ]
      • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
      • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
      • filename equals 'system-auth'
      • pattern equals '^[^#]*\s*nullok\s*'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'auth required pam_env.so auth required pam_faildelay.so delay=2000000 auth sufficient pam_unix.so nullok try_first_pass auth requisite pam_succeed_if.so uid >= 1000 quiet_success auth required pam_deny.so account required pam_unix.so account sufficient pam_localuser.so account sufficient pam_succeed_if.so uid < 1000 quiet account required pam_permit.so password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type= password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512 shadow nullok '
      • line equals 'auth required pam_env.so auth required pam_faildelay.so delay=2000000 auth sufficient pam_unix.so nullok try_first_pass auth requisite pam_succeed_if.so uid >= 1000 quiet_success auth required pam_deny.so account required pam_unix.so account sufficient pam_localuser.so account sufficient pam_succeed_if.so uid < 1000 quiet account required pam_permit.so password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type= password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512 shadow nullok '
      • subexpression does not exist
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:123000 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/password-auth
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:296400 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam.d/password-auth'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[^#]*\s*nullok\s*'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ not evaluated ]
      • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/password-auth'
      • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
      • filename equals 'password-auth'
      • pattern equals '^[^#]*\s*nullok\s*'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'auth required pam_env.so auth required pam_faildelay.so delay=2000000 auth sufficient pam_unix.so nullok try_first_pass auth requisite pam_succeed_if.so uid >= 1000 quiet_success auth required pam_deny.so account required pam_unix.so account sufficient pam_localuser.so account sufficient pam_succeed_if.so uid < 1000 quiet account required pam_permit.so password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type= password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512 shadow nullok '
      • line equals 'auth required pam_env.so auth required pam_faildelay.so delay=2000000 auth sufficient pam_unix.so nullok try_first_pass auth requisite pam_succeed_if.so uid >= 1000 quiet_success auth required pam_deny.so account required pam_unix.so account sufficient pam_localuser.so account sufficient pam_succeed_if.so uid < 1000 quiet account required pam_permit.so password requisite pam_pwquality.so try_first_pass local_users_only retry=3 authtok_type= password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512 shadow nullok '
      • subexpression does not exist
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not allow authentication using an empty password.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204425r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-010300
      Identities:CCE-27471-2
      SV-86563
      V-71939
      CCI-000766 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-2 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-2 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (2))
      Description: Configuring this setting for the SSH daemon provides additional assurance that remote logon via SSH will require a password, even in the event of misconfiguration elsewhere. false
      Fix Text:To explicitly disallow remote logon from accounts with empty passwords, add or correct the following line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config":

      PermitEmptyPasswords no

      The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect. Any accounts with empty passwords should be disabled immediately, and PAM configuration should prevent users from being able to assign themselves empty passwords.
      Severity:high
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1375
      Result:true
      Title:Disable Empty Passwords
      Description:Remote connections from accounts with empty passwords should be disabled (and dependencies are met)
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true (/etc/ssh/sshd_config PermitEmptyPasswords)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (package openssh-server is removed)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1376 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:/etc/ssh/sshd_config PermitEmptyPasswords
      Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3061 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • behavior requirements:
        • ignore_case = true
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*PermitEmptyPasswords[ \t]+([^\s#]*)[ \t]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:137500 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(no|"no")$'
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
      Result:true
      Title:package openssh-server is removed
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must disable account identifiers (individuals, groups, roles, and devices) if the password expires.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204426r809190_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-010310
      Identities:CCE-27471-2
      SV-86565
      V-71941
      CCI-000795 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-4 e; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-4.1 (iii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-4 e)
      Description: Inactive identifiers pose a risk to systems and applications because attackers may exploit an inactive identifier and potentially obtain undetected access to the system. Owners of inactive accounts will not notice if unauthorized access to their user account has been obtained.

      Operating systems need to track periods of inactivity and disable application identifiers after 35 days of inactivity. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable account identifiers (individuals, groups, roles, and devices) 35 days after the password expires.

      Add the following line to "/etc/default/useradd" (or modify the line to have the required value):

      INACTIVE=35
      DoD recommendation is 35 days, but a lower value is acceptable. The value "-1" will disable this feature, and "0" will disable the account immediately after the password expires.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:443
      Result:false
      Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must disable account identifiers (individuals, groups, roles, and devices) if the password expires.
      Description:Inactive identifiers pose a risk to systems and applications because attackers may exploit an inactive identifier and potentially obtain undetected access to the system. Owners of inactive accounts will not notice if unauthorized access to their user account has been obtained. Operating systems need to track periods of inactivity and disable application identifiers after zero35 days of inactivity.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (the value INACTIVE parameter should be set appropriately in /etc/default/useradd)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:444 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:the value INACTIVE parameter should be set appropriately in /etc/default/useradd
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      State Operator:All item-state comparisons must be true.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2333 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/default/useradd'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*INACTIVE\s*=\s*(\d+)\s*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2334 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be less than or equal to '35'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2335 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be greater than or equal to '0'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that users must provide a password for privilege escalation.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204429r833190_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-010340
      Identities:CCE-80351-0
      V-71947
      SV-86571
      CCI-002038 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-11)
      Description: Without re-authentication, users may access resources or perform tasks for which they do not have authorization.

      When operating systems provide the capability to escalate a functional capability, it is critical the user re-authenticate.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00156, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00157, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00158 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to require users to supply a password for privilege escalation.

      Check the configuration of the "/etc/sudoers" file with the following command:
      $ sudo visudo

      Remove any occurrences of "NOPASSWD" tags in the file.

      Check the configuration of the /etc/sudoers.d/* files with the following command:
      $ sudo grep -ir nopasswd /etc/sudoers.d

      Remove any occurrences of "NOPASSWD" tags in the file.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:176
      Result:false
      Title:Ensure NOPASSWD Is Not Used in Sudo
      Description:Checks sudo usage without password
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (NOPASSWD does not exist /etc/sudoers)
        • false (NOPASSWD does not exist in /etc/sudoers.d)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:177 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:NOPASSWD does not exist /etc/sudoers
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2108 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sudoers'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^(?!#).*[\s]+NOPASSWD[\s]*\:.*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:178 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:NOPASSWD does not exist in /etc/sudoers.d
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2109 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/sudoers.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^(?!#).*[\s]+NOPASSWD[\s]*\:.*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ not evaluated ]
      • filepath equals '/etc/sudoers.d/90-cloud-init-users'
      • path equals '/etc/sudoers.d'
      • filename equals '90-cloud-init-users'
      • pattern equals '^(?!#).*[\s]+NOPASSWD[\s]*\:.*$'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'centos ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL'
      • line equals 'centos ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL'
      • subexpression does not exist
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that users must re-authenticate for privilege escalation.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204430r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-010350
      Identities:CCE-80350-2
      V-71949
      SV-86573
      CCI-002038 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-11)
      Description: Without re-authentication, users may access resources or perform tasks for which they do not have authorization.

      When operating systems provide the capability to escalate a functional capability, it is critical the user reauthenticate.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00156, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00157, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00158 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to require users to reauthenticate for privilege escalation.

      Check the configuration of the "/etc/sudoers" file with the following command:

      # visudo
      Remove any occurrences of "!authenticate" tags in the file.

      Check the configuration of the "/etc/sudoers.d/*" files with the following command:

      # grep -i authenticate /etc/sudoers /etc/sudoers.d/*
      Remove any occurrences of "!authenticate" tags in the file(s).
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:173
      Result:true

      Description:Checks sudo usage without authentication
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (!authenticate does not exist in /etc/sudoers)
        • true (!authenticate does not exist in /etc/sudoers.d)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:174 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:!authenticate does not exist in /etc/sudoers
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2106 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sudoers'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^(?!#).*[\s]+\!\s*authenticate.*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:175 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:!authenticate does not exist in /etc/sudoers.d
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2107 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/sudoers.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^(?!#).*[\s]+\!\s*authenticate.*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the delay between logon prompts following a failed console logon attempt is at least four seconds.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204431r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-010430
      Identities:CCE-80352-8
      SV-86575
      V-71951
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: Configuring the operating system to implement organization-wide security implementation guides and security checklists verifies compliance with federal standards and establishes a common security baseline across DoD that reflects the most restrictive security posture consistent with operational requirements.

      Configuration settings are the set of parameters that can be changed in hardware, software, or firmware components of the system that affect the security posture and/or functionality of the system. Security-related parameters are those parameters impacting the security state of the system, including the parameters required to satisfy other security control requirements. Security-related parameters include, for example, registry settings; account, file, and directory permission settings; and settings for functions, ports, protocols, services, and remote connections. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to enforce a delay of at least four seconds between logon prompts following a failed console logon attempt.

      Modify the "/etc/login.defs" file to set the "FAIL_DELAY" parameter to "4" or greater:

      FAIL_DELAY 4
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:101
      Result:false
      Title:Ensure that FAIL_DELAY is Configured in /etc/login.defs
      Description:The delay between failed authentication attempts should be set for all users specified in /etc/login.defs
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (check FAIL_DELAY in /etc/login.defs)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:102 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:check FAIL_DELAY in /etc/login.defs
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2055 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/login.defs'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*FAIL_DELAY[\s]+([^#\s]*)'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2056 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • for check = 'all', subexpression, the following must be true:
        • subexpression must be greater than or equal to '4'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow an unattended or automatic logon to the system via a graphical user interface.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204432r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-010440
      Identities:CCE-80104-3
      V-71953
      SV-86577
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: Failure to restrict system access to authenticated users negatively impacts operating system security. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to not allow an unattended or automatic logon to the system via a graphical user interface.

      Note: If the system does not have GNOME installed, this requirement is Not Applicable.

      Add or edit the line for the "AutomaticLoginEnable" parameter in the [daemon] section of the "/etc/gdm/custom.conf" file to "false":

      [daemon]
      AutomaticLoginEnable=false
      Severity:high
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:

      Result:true

      Description:Disable the GNOME Display Manager (GDM) ability to allow users to automatically login.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (AutomaticLoginEnable present in daemon section)
          • false (All AutomaticLoginEnable lines are set correctly)
        • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (package gdm is installed)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1121 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:AutomaticLoginEnable present in daemon section
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.

      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/gdm/custom.conf'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\[daemon]\n(?!([^\n]*\n+)*\[[^\n\]]*]([^\n]*\n+)*AutomaticLoginEnable[ ]?=[ ]?)([^\n]*\n+)*AutomaticLoginEnable[ ]?=[ ]?'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:111900 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:All AutomaticLoginEnable lines are set correctly
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:111900 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/gdm/custom.conf'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*AutomaticLoginEnable[ ]?=[ ]?([^\W]*)[ ]*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:111900 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^[Ff][Aa][Ll][Ss][Ee]$'

      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.

      Object Requirements:
      • name must be equal to 'gdm'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow users to override SSH environment variables.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204434r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-010460
      Identities:CCE-27363-1
      SV-86581
      V-71957
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: Failure to restrict system access to authenticated users negatively impacts operating system security. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to not allow users to override environment variables to the SSH daemon.

      Edit the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file to uncomment or add the line for "PermitUserEnvironment" keyword and set the value to "no":

      PermitUserEnvironment no

      The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1385
      Result:true
      Title:Do Not Allow Users to Set Environment Options
      Description:PermitUserEnvironment should be disabled
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (Check value of PermitUserEnvironment in /etc/ssh/sshd_config)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (package openssh-server is removed)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1386 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:Check value of PermitUserEnvironment in /etc/ssh/sshd_config
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3066 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)PermitUserEnvironment(?-i)[\s]+(\w*)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:138600 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal (case insensitive) to 'no'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
      Result:true
      Title:package openssh-server is removed
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow a non-certificate trusted host SSH logon to the system.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204435r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-010470
      Identities:CCE-27413-4
      SV-86583
      V-71959
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: Failure to restrict system access to authenticated users negatively impacts operating system security. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to not allow a non-certificate trusted host SSH logon to the system.

      Edit the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file to uncomment or add the line for "HostbasedAuthentication" keyword and set the value to "no":

      HostbasedAuthentication no

      The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA

      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

        • false (sshd HostbasedAuthentication)

          • true (package openssh-server is removed)

      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)HostbasedAuthentication(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:101200 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal (case insensitive) to 'no'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
      Result:true
      Title:package openssh-server is removed
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204437r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-010481
      Identities:V-77823
      SV-92519
      CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
      Description: If the system does not require valid root authentication before it boots into single-user or maintenance mode, anyone who invokes single-user or maintenance mode is granted privileged access to all files on the system. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes.

      Add or modify the "ExecStart" line in "/usr/lib/systemd/system/rescue.service" to include "/usr/sbin/sulogin":

      ExecStart=-/bin/sh -c "/usr/sbin/sulogin; /usr/bin/systemctl --fail --no-block default"
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:92519
      Result:true
      Title:Require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes.
      Description:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (check in /usr/lib/systemd/system/rescue.service for the option /usr/sbin/sulogin assinged to ExecStart)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9251900 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:check in /usr/lib/systemd/system/rescue.service for the option /usr/sbin/sulogin assinged to ExecStart
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9251900 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
      • filename must be equal to 'rescue.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*ExecStart=([^\n#]+)$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9251900 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '['"; ]*\/usr\/sbin\/sulogin['"; ]*'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ true ]
      • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/rescue.service'
      • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
      • filename equals 'rescue.service'
      • pattern equals '^\s*ExecStart=([^\n#]+)$'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'ExecStart=-/bin/sh -c "/usr/sbin/sulogin; /usr/bin/systemctl --fail --no-block default"'
      • line equals 'ExecStart=-/bin/sh -c "/usr/sbin/sulogin; /usr/bin/systemctl --fail --no-block default"'
      • subexpression equals '-/bin/sh -c "/usr/sbin/sulogin; /usr/bin/systemctl --fail --no-block default"'

      Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating systems version 7.2 or newer with a Basic Input/Output System (BIOS) must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204438r744095_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-010482
      Identities:CCE-27309-4
      SV-95717
      V-81005
      CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
      Description: If the system does not require valid authentication before it boots into single-user or maintenance mode, anyone who invokes single-user or maintenance mode is granted privileged access to all files on the system. GRUB 2 is the default boot loader for RHEL 7 and is designed to require a password to boot into single-user mode or make modifications to the boot menu. false
      Fix Text:Configure the system to encrypt the boot password for the grub superusers account with the grub2-setpassword command, which creates/overwrites the /boot/grub2/user.cfg file.

      Generate an encrypted grub2 password for the grub superusers account with the following command:

      $ sudo grub2-setpassword
      Enter password:
      Confirm password:
      Severity:high
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:95717
      Result:false
      Title:Set Boot Loader Password (BIOS) for RHEL 7.2 and up
      Description:The grub2 boot loader should have password protection enabled.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (make sure a password is defined in /boot/grub2/user.cfg)
          • true (superuser is defined in /boot/grub2/grub.cfg files.)
        • false (Running RHEL 7.0 or 7.1?)
        • false (/boot/grub2/grub.cfg does not exist)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9571700 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:make sure a password is defined in /boot/grub2/user.cfg
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9571700 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/boot/grub2/user.cfg'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*GRUB2_PASSWORD=grub\.pbkdf2\.sha512\.\S+$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9571701 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:superuser is defined in /boot/grub2/grub.cfg files.
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9571701 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*set[\s]+superusers=\"\S+\"\s*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ not evaluated ]
      • filepath equals '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
      • path equals '/boot/grub2'
      • filename equals 'grub.cfg'
      • pattern equals '^[\s]*set[\s]+superusers=\"\S+\"\s*$'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals ' set superusers="root"'
      • line equals ' set superusers="root"'
      • subexpression does not exist
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8658500 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:Running RHEL 7.0 or 7.1?
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:16900 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/redhat-release'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^Red Hat Enterprise Linux.*release\s+(\S+)\s+'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8658500 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '7.0'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8658501 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '7.1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:909 (file_test)
      Result:false
      Title:/boot/grub2/grub.cfg does not exist
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2710 (file_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ not evaluated ]
      • filepath equals '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
      • path equals '/boot/grub2'
      • filename equals 'grub.cfg'
      • type equals 'regular'
      • group_id equals '0'
      • user_id equals '0'
      • a_time equals '1668178822'
      • c_time equals '1667610652'
      • m_time equals '1667610652'
      • size equals '6834'
      • suid equals '0'
      • sgid equals '0'
      • sticky equals '0'
      • uread equals '1'
      • uwrite equals '1'
      • uexec equals '0'
      • gread equals '1'
      • gwrite equals '0'
      • gexec equals '0'
      • oread equals '1'
      • owrite equals '0'
      • oexec equals '0'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating systems version 7.2 or newer using Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204440r744098_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-010491
      Identities:CCE-80354-4
      SV-95719
      V-81007
      CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
      Description: If the system does not require valid authentication before it boots into single-user or maintenance mode, anyone who invokes single-user or maintenance mode is granted privileged access to all files on the system. GRUB 2 is the default boot loader for RHEL 7 and is designed to require a password to boot into single-user mode or make modifications to the boot menu. false
      Fix Text:Configure the system to encrypt the boot password for the grub superusers account with the grub2-setpassword command, which creates/overwrites the /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/user.cfg file.

      $ sudo grub2-setpassword
      Enter password:
      Confirm password:
      Severity:high

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have the rsh-server package installed.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204442r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-020000
      Identities:CCE-27342-5
      V-71967
      SV-86591
      CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
      Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

      Operating systems are capable of providing a wide variety of functions and services. Some of the functions and services, provided by default, may not be necessary to support essential organizational operations (e.g., key missions, functions).

      The rsh-server service provides an unencrypted remote access service that does not provide for the confidentiality and integrity of user passwords or the remote session and has very weak authentication.

      If a privileged user were to log on using this service, the privileged user password could be compromised. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable non-essential capabilities by removing the rsh-server package from the system with the following command:

      # yum remove rsh-server
      Severity:high
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1271
      Result:true
      Title:Package rsh-server Removed
      Description:The RPM package rsh-server should be removed.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (package rsh-server is removed)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1272 (rpminfo_test)
      Result:true
      Title:package rsh-server is removed
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2996 (rpminfo_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • name must be equal to 'rsh-server'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have the ypserv package installed.

      Description: Removing the "ypserv" package decreases the risk of the accidental (or intentional) activation of NIS or NIS+ services. false

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that a file integrity tool verifies the baseline operating system configuration at least weekly.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204445r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-020030
      Identities:CCE-26952-2
      SV-86597
      V-71973
      CCI-001744 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-3 (5); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-3 (5))
      Description: Unauthorized changes to the baseline configuration could make the system vulnerable to various attacks or allow unauthorized access to the operating system. Changes to operating system configurations can have unintended side effects, some of which may be relevant to security.

      Detecting such changes and providing an automated response can help avoid unintended, negative consequences that could ultimately affect the security state of the operating system. The operating system's Information Management Officer (IMO)/Information System Security Officer (ISSO) and System Administrators (SAs) must be notified via email and/or monitoring system trap when there is an unauthorized modification of a configuration item. false
      Fix Text:Configure the file integrity tool to run automatically on the system at least weekly. The following example output is generic. It will set cron to run AIDE daily, but other file integrity tools may be used:

      # more /etc/cron.daily/aide
      #!/bin/bash

      /usr/sbin/aide --check | /bin/mail -s "$HOSTNAME - Daily aide integrity check run" root@sysname.mil
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:525
      Result:false
      Title:Configure Periodic Execution of AIDE
      Description:By default, AIDE does not install itself for periodic execution. Periodically running AIDE is necessary to reveal unexpected changes in installed files.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (run aide daily with /etc/crontab)
          • false (run aide daily with /etc/cron.d)
          • false (run aide daily with /var/spool/cron/root)
          • false (run aide daily with cron.daily)
          • false (run aide daily with cron.weekly)
          • false (run aide daily with cron.hourly)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (package aide is installed)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:527 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:run aide daily with /etc/crontab
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2412 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/crontab'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*([\S]+[ \t]+[\S]+[ \t]+\*[ \t]+\*[ \t]+[\S]+)[ \t]+root[ \t]+\/usr\/sbin\/aide[ \t]+\-\-check(?:[\s]+|[\>\|]|$)'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2412 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '((?:[0-5]?[0-9]|\*)[ \t]+(?:[01]?[0-9]|2[0-3]|\*)[ \t]+\*[ \t]+\*[ \t]+(?:[0-7]|sun|mon|tue|wed|thu|fri|sat))'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2413 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '((?:[0-5]?[0-9]|\*)[ \t]+(?:[01]?[0-9]|2[0-3])[ \t]+\*[ \t]+\*[ \t]+(?:[0-7]|sun|mon|tue|wed|thu|fri|sat|\*))'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2414 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '((?:[0-5]?[0-9])[ \t]+(?:[01]?[0-9]|2[0-3]|\*)[ \t]+\*[ \t]+\*[ \t]+(?:[0-7]|sun|mon|tue|wed|thu|fri|sat|\*))'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:528 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:run aide daily with /etc/cron.d
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2413 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/cron.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '^.+$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*([\S]+[ \t]+[\S]+[ \t]+\*[ \t]+\*[ \t]+[\S]+)[ \t]+root[ \t]+\/usr\/sbin\/aide[ \t]+\-\-check(?:[\s]+|[\>\|]|$)'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2412 (textfilecontent54_state)

      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '((?:[0-5]?[0-9])[ \t]+(?:[01]?[0-9]|2[0-3]|\*)[ \t]+\*[ \t]+\*[ \t]+(?:[0-7]|sun|mon|tue|wed|thu|fri|sat|\*))'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:529 (textfilecontent54_test)

      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2414 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/var/spool/cron/root'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*([\S]+[ \t]+[\S]+[ \t]+\*[ \t]+\*[ \t]+[\S]+)[ \t]+\/usr\/sbin\/aide[ \t]+\-\-check(?:[\s]+|[\>\|]|$)'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2412 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '((?:[0-5]?[0-9]|\*)[ \t]+(?:[01]?[0-9]|2[0-3]|\*)[ \t]+\*[ \t]+\*[ \t]+(?:[0-7]|sun|mon|tue|wed|thu|fri|sat))'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2413 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '((?:[0-5]?[0-9]|\*)[ \t]+(?:[01]?[0-9]|2[0-3])[ \t]+\*[ \t]+\*[ \t]+(?:[0-7]|sun|mon|tue|wed|thu|fri|sat|\*))'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2414 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '((?:[0-5]?[0-9])[ \t]+(?:[01]?[0-9]|2[0-3]|\*)[ \t]+\*[ \t]+\*[ \t]+(?:[0-7]|sun|mon|tue|wed|thu|fri|sat|\*))'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:530 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:run aide daily with cron.daily
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2415 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/cron.daily'
      • filename must match the pattern '^.+$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*/usr/sbin/aide[ \t]*\-\-check(?:[\s]+|[\>\|]|$)'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8659700 (textfilecontent54_test)

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent the installation of software, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components from a repository without verification they have been digitally signed using a certificate that is issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that is recognized and approved by the organization.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204447r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-020050
      Identities:CCE-26989-4
      V-71977
      SV-86601
      CCI-001749 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (3))
      Description: Changes to any software components can have significant effects on the overall security of the operating system. This requirement ensures the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor.

      Accordingly, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components must be signed with a certificate recognized and approved by the organization.

      Verifying the authenticity of the software prior to installation validates the integrity of the patch or upgrade received from a vendor. This verifies the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor. Self-signed certificates are disallowed by this requirement. The operating system should not have to verify the software again. This requirement does not mandate DoD certificates for this purpose; however, the certificate used to verify the software must be from an approved CA. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to verify the signature of packages from a repository prior to install by setting the following option in the "/etc/yum.conf" file:

      gpgcheck=1
      Severity:high
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1027
      Result:true
      Title:Ensure Yum gpgcheck Globally Activated
      Description:The gpgcheck option should be used to ensure that checking of an RPM package's signature always occurs prior to its installation.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true (check value of gpgcheck in /etc/yum.conf)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1029 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:check value of gpgcheck in /etc/yum.conf
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2796 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/yum.conf'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*gpgcheck\s*=\s*(\S+)\s*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:102700 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ true ]
      • filepath equals '/etc/yum.conf'
      • path equals '/etc'
      • filename equals 'yum.conf'
      • pattern equals '^\s*gpgcheck\s*=\s*(\S+)\s*$'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'gpgcheck=1'
      • line equals 'gpgcheck=1'
      • subexpression equals '1'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent the installation of software, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components of local packages without verification they have been digitally signed using a certificate that is issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that is recognized and approved by the organization.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204448r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-020060
      Identities:CCE-80347-8
      V-71979
      SV-86603
      CCI-001749 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (3))
      Description: Changes to any software components can have significant effects on the overall security of the operating system. This requirement ensures the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor.

      Accordingly, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components must be signed with a certificate recognized and approved by the organization.

      Verifying the authenticity of the software prior to installation validates the integrity of the patch or upgrade received from a vendor. This verifies the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor. Self-signed certificates are disallowed by this requirement. The operating system should not have to verify the software again. This requirement does not mandate DoD certificates for this purpose; however, the certificate used to verify the software must be from an approved CA. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to verify the signature of local packages prior to install by setting the following option in the "/etc/yum.conf" file:

      localpkg_gpgcheck=1
      Severity:high
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

      Result:false

      Description:The localpkg_gpgcheck option should be used to ensure that checking of an RPM package's signature always occurs prior to its installation.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (check value of localpkg_gpgcheck in /etc/yum.conf)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:111 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:check value of localpkg_gpgcheck in /etc/yum.conf
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2062 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/yum.conf'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*localpkg_gpgcheck\s*=\s*(\S+)\s*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to disable USB mass storage.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204449r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-020100
      Identities:SV-86607
      V-71983
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      CCI-000778 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-3; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-3.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-3)
      CCI-001958 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-3)
      Description: USB mass storage permits easy introduction of unknown devices, thereby facilitating malicious activity.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000114-GPOS-00059, SRG-OS-000378-GPOS-00163, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable the ability to use the USB Storage kernel module.

      Create a file under "/etc/modprobe.d" with the following command:

      # touch /etc/modprobe.d/usb-storage.conf

      Add the following line to the created file:

      install usb-storage /bin/true

      Configure the operating system to disable the ability to use USB mass storage devices.

      # vi /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf

      Add or update the line:

      blacklist usb-storage
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1141
      Result:false
      Title:Disable usb-storage Kernel Module
      Description:The kernel module usb-storage should be disabled.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (kernel module usb-storage disabled)
        • false (kernel module usb-storage blacklisted in /etc/modprobe.d)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1142 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:kernel module usb-storage disabled
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2892 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*install\s+usb-storage\s+(\S+)\s*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8660700 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '/bin/true'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8660700 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:kernel module usb-storage blacklisted in /etc/modprobe.d
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8660700 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/modprobe.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*blacklist\s+usb-storage\s*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the Datagram Congestion Control Protocol (DCCP) kernel module is disabled unless required.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204450r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-020101
      Identities:V-77821
      SV-92517
      CCI-001958 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-3)
      Description: Disabling DCCP protects the system against exploitation of any flaws in the protocol implementation. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable the ability to use the DCCP kernel module.

      Create a file under "/etc/modprobe.d" with the following command:

      # touch /etc/modprobe.d/dccp.conf

      Add the following line to the created file:

      install dccp /bin/true

      Ensure that the DCCP module is blacklisted:

      # vi /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf

      Add or update the line:

      blacklist dccp
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must disable the file system automounter unless required.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204451r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-020110
      Identities:CCE-27498-5
      V-71985
      SV-86609
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      CCI-000778 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-3; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-3.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-3)
      CCI-001958 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-3)
      Description: Automatically mounting file systems permits easy introduction of unknown devices, thereby facilitating malicious activity.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000114-GPOS-00059, SRG-OS-000378-GPOS-00163, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable the ability to automount devices.

      Turn off the automount service with the following commands:

      # systemctl stop autofs
      # systemctl disable autofs

      If "autofs" is required for Network File System (NFS), it must be documented with the ISSO.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:86609
      Result:true
      Title:File system automounter must be disabled unless required.
      Description:Automatically mounting file systems permits easy introduction of unknown devices, thereby facilitating malicious activity.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (check for automount)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8660900 (process58_test)
      Result:true
      Title:check for automount
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8660900 (process58_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • command_line must match the pattern '^(/usr)?/sbin/automount.*'
      • pid must be greater than '1'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must remove all software components after updated versions have been installed.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204452r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-020200
      Identities:CCE-80346-0
      V-71987
      SV-86611
      CCI-002617 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-2 (6); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SI-2 (6))
      Description: Previous versions of software components that are not removed from the information system after updates have been installed may be exploited by adversaries. Some information technology products may remove older versions of software automatically from the information system. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to remove all software components after updated versions have been installed.

      Set the "clean_requirements_on_remove" option to "1" in the "/etc/yum.conf" file:

      clean_requirements_on_remove=1
      Severity:low
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:

      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (check value of clean_requirements_on_remove in /etc/yum.conf)
      Tests:

      Title:check value of clean_requirements_on_remove in /etc/yum.conf

      • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*clean_requirements_on_remove\s*=\s*(\S+)\s*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must define default permissions for all authenticated users in such a way that the user can only read and modify their own files.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204457r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-020240
      Identities:CCE-80205-8
      SV-86619
      V-71995
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: Setting the most restrictive default permissions ensures that when new accounts are created, they do not have unnecessary access. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to define default permissions for all authenticated users in such a way that the user can only read and modify their own files.

      Add or edit the line for the "UMASK" parameter in "/etc/login.defs" file to "077":

      UMASK 077
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:518
      Result:true
      Title:RHEL-07-020240 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must define default permissions for all authenticated users in such a way that the user can only read and modify their own files.
      Description:Setting the most restrictive default permissions ensures that when new accounts are created, they do not have unnecessary access.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (/etc/login.defs:UMASK == 077)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:51800 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:/etc/login.defs:UMASK == 077
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3737 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/login.defs'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)UMASK(?-i)[\s]+([^#\s]*)'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:51800 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '077'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ true ]
      • filepath equals '/etc/login.defs'
      • path equals '/etc'
      • filename equals 'login.defs'
      • pattern equals '^[\s]*(?i)UMASK(?-i)[\s]+([^#\s]*)'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'UMASK 077'
      • line equals 'UMASK 077'
      • subexpression equals '077'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be a vendor supported release.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204458r744100_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-020250
      Identities:CCE-80349-4
      SV-86621
      V-71997
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: An operating system release is considered "supported" if the vendor continues to provide security patches for the product. With an unsupported release, it will not be possible to resolve security issues discovered in the system software.

      Red Hat offers the Extended Update Support (EUS) Add-On to a Red Hat Enterprise Linux subscription, for a fee, for those customers who wish to standardize on a specific minor release for an extended period. RHEL 7.7 marks the final minor release that EUS will be available, while 7.9 is the final minor release overall. false
      Fix Text:Upgrade to a supported version of the operating system.
      Severity:high
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:169
      Result:false
      Title:RHEL-07-020250 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be a vendor supported release
      Description:An operating system release is considered "supported" if the vendor continues to provide security patches for the product. With an unsupported release, it will not be possible to resolve security issues discovered in the system software.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (Supported RHEL7 minor version)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (redhat-release-virtualization-host RPM package is installed)
            • false (RHEVH base RHEL is version 7)
          • false (redhat-release-client is version 7)
          • false (redhat-release-workstation is version 7)
          • false (redhat-release-server is version 7)
          • false (redhat-release-computenode is version 7)

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all Group Identifiers (GIDs) referenced in the /etc/passwd file are defined in the /etc/group file.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204461r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-020300
      Identities:CCE-27503-2
      V-72003
      SV-86627
      CCI-000764 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-2; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-2.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2)
      Description: If a user is assigned the GID of a group not existing on the system, and a group with the GID is subsequently created, the user may have unintended rights to any files associated with the group. false
      Fix Text:Configure the system to define all GIDs found in the "/etc/passwd" file by modifying the "/etc/group" file to add any non-existent group referenced in the "/etc/passwd" file, or change the GIDs referenced in the "/etc/passwd" file to a group that exists in "/etc/group".
      Severity:low
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1117
      Result:true
      Title:All GIDs Are Present In /etc/group
      Description:All GIDs referenced in /etc/passwd must be defined in /etc/group.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (Verify all GIDs referenced in /etc/passwd are defined in /etc/group)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1118 (textfilecontent54_test)

      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
