      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:audit auditctl
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the creat, open, openat, open_by_handle_at, truncate, and ftruncate syscalls.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204531r809815_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030510
      Identities:CCE-80386-6
      SV-86749
      V-72125
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

      Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

      When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

      The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall made by all programs on the system. Therefore, it is very important to use syscall rules only when absolutely necessary since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. The performance can be helped, however, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000461-GPOS-00205, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records upon successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "creat", "open", "openat", "open_by_handle_at", "truncate", and "ftruncate" syscalls.

      Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S creat,open,openat,open_by_handle_at,truncate,ftruncate -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k access

      -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S creat,open,openat,open_by_handle_at,truncate,ftruncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k access

      -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S creat,open,openat,open_by_handle_at,truncate,ftruncate -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k access

      -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S creat,open,openat,open_by_handle_at,truncate,ftruncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k access

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:805
      Result:error
      Title:RHEL-07-030510 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the creat, open, openat, open_by_handle_at, truncate and ftruncate syscalls.
      Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one. Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way. The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall that all programs on the system makes. Therefore, it is very important to only use syscall rules when you have to since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. You can help the performance, though, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.

      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the semanage command.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204536r833109_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030560
      Identities:CCE-80391-6
      SV-86759
      V-72135
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

      Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

      When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000465-GPOS-00209 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "semanage" command occur.

      Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/semanage -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-priv_change

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:618
      Result:error
      Title:Record Any Attempts to Run semanage
      Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of semanage is enabled.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (All child checks must be true.)
          • error (audit augenrules semanage)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (audit augenrules)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl semanage)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:619 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:error
      Title:audit augenrules semanage
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2484 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/sbin\/semanage[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*)?x([rwa]*)?[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:audit augenrules
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ not evaluated ]
      • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
      • filename equals 'auditd.service'
      • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
      • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
      • subexpression does not exist
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:620 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:audit auditctl semanage
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2485 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/sbin\/semanage[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*)?x([rwa]*)?[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:audit auditctl
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the setsebool command.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204537r833112_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030570
      Identities:CCE-80392-4
      V-72137
      SV-86761
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

      Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

      When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000465-GPOS-00209 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "setsebool" command occur.

      Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/setsebool -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-priv_change

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:

      • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (All child checks must be true.)
          • error (audit augenrules setsebool)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (audit augenrules)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl setsebool)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl)

      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2486 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/sbin\/setsebool[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)

      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chcon command.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204538r833115_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030580
      Identities:CCE-80393-2
      V-72139
      SV-86763
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

      Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

      When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000465-GPOS-00209 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "chcon" command occur.

      Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/chcon -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-priv_change

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:612
      Result:error
      Title:Record Any Attempts to Run chcon
      Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of chcon is enabled.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (All child checks must be true.)
          • error (audit augenrules chcon)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (audit augenrules)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl chcon)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:613 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:error
      Title:audit augenrules chcon
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2480 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/chcon[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:audit augenrules
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ not evaluated ]
      • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
      • filename equals 'auditd.service'
      • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
      • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
      • subexpression does not exist
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:614 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:audit auditctl chcon
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2481 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/chcon[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:audit auditctl
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the setfiles command.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204539r833118_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030590
      Identities:V-72141
      SV-86765
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

      Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

      When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all unsuccessful account access events.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204540r603261_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030610
      Identities:CCE-80383-3
      V-72145
      SV-86769
      CCI-000126 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-2.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-2 c)
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

      Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000473-GPOS-00218 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when unsuccessful account access events occur.

      Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -w /var/run/faillock -p wa -k logins

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899

      Result:error
      Title:Record Attempts to Alter Login and Logout Events - faillock
      Description:Audit rules should be configured to log successful and unsuccessful login and logout events.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (All child checks must be true.)
          • error (audit augenrules faillock)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (audit augenrules)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl faillock)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl)

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all successful account access events.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204541r603261_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030620
      Identities:CCE-80384-1
      V-72147
      SV-86771
      CCI-000126 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-2.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-2 c)
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

      Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

      -w /var/log/lastlog -p wa -k logins

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the passwd command.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204542r833121_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030630
      Identities:CCE-80395-7
      SV-86773
      V-72149
      CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

      At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged password commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

      When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "passwd" command occur.

      Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/passwd -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-passwd

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:733
      Result:error
      Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - passwd
      Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of passwd is enabled.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (All child checks must be true.)
          • error (audit augenrules passwd)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (audit augenrules)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl passwd)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:734 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:error
      Title:audit augenrules passwd
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2570 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/passwd[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:audit augenrules
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ not evaluated ]
      • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
      • filename equals 'auditd.service'
      • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
      • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
      • subexpression does not exist
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:735 (textfilecontent54_test)

      Title:audit auditctl passwd
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.

      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/passwd[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'

      Result:false

      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the unix_chkpwd command.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204543r833124_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030640
      Identities:CCE-80396-5
      SV-86775
      V-72151
      CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

      At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged password commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

      When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "unix_chkpwd" command occur.

      Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/unix_chkpwd -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-passwd

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:760
      Result:error
      Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - unix_chkpwd
      Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of unix_chkpwd is enabled.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (All child checks must be true.)
          • error (audit augenrules unix_chkpwd)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (audit augenrules)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl unix_chkpwd)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:761 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:error
      Title:audit augenrules unix_chkpwd
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2588 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=(\/usr)?\/sbin\/unix_chkpwd[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:audit augenrules
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ not evaluated ]
      • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
      • filename equals 'auditd.service'
      • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
      • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
      • subexpression does not exist
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:762 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:audit auditctl unix_chkpwd
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2589 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=(\/usr)?\/sbin\/unix_chkpwd[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:audit auditctl
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the gpasswd command.

      Version:RHEL-07-030650

      SV-86777

      At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged password commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

      • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/sbin\/userhelper[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:audit augenrules
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ not evaluated ]
      • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
      • filename equals 'auditd.service'
      • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
      • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
      • subexpression does not exist
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:765 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:audit auditctl userhelper
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2591 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/sbin\/userhelper[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:audit auditctl
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the su command.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204547r833136_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030680
      Identities:CCE-80400-5
      SV-86783
      V-72159
      CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
      CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

      At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged access commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

      When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "su" command occur.

      Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/su -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-priv_change

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:748
      Result:error
      Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - su
      Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of su is enabled.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (All child checks must be true.)
          • error (audit augenrules su)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (audit augenrules)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl su)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:749 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:error
      Title:audit augenrules su
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2580 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=(\/usr)?\/bin\/su[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:audit augenrules
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ not evaluated ]
      • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
      • filename equals 'auditd.service'
      • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
      • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
      • subexpression does not exist
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:750 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:audit auditctl su
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2581 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=(\/usr)?\/bin\/su[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:audit auditctl
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the sudo command.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204548r833139_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030690
      Identities:CCE-80401-3
      V-72161

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the sudoers file and all files in the /etc/sudoers.d/ directory.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204549r603261_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030700
      Identities:CCE-27461-3
      V-72163
      SV-86787
      CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
      CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

      At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged access commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to access the "/etc/sudoers" file and files in the "/etc/sudoers.d/" directory.

      Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -w /etc/sudoers -p wa -k privileged-actions

      -w /etc/sudoers.d/ -p wa -k privileged-actions

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:773
      Result:error
      Title:Audit System Administrator Actions
      Description:Audit actions taken by system administrators on the system.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (All child checks must be true.)
          • error (audit augenrules sudoers)
          • error (audit augenrules sudoers.d)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (audit augenrules)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl sudoers)
          • false (audit auditctl sudoers.d)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:774 (textfilecontent54_test)

      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2598 (textfilecontent54_object)

      • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\-w[\s]+/etc/sudoers[\s]+\-p[\s]+\b([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*)\b[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the newgrp command.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204550r833142_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030710
      Identities:CCE-80403-9
      V-72165
      SV-86789
      CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
      CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

      At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged access commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

      When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1.       Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "newgrp" command occur.

      Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/newgrp -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-priv_change

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:727
      Result:error
      Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - newgrp
      Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of newgrp is enabled.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (All child checks must be true.)
          • error (audit augenrules newgrp)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (audit augenrules)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl newgrp)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:728 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:error
      Title:audit augenrules newgrp
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2566 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/newgrp[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)

      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chsh command.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204551r833145_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030720
      Identities:CCE-80404-7
      SV-86791
      V-72167
      CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
      CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

      At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged access commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

      When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "chsh" command occur.

      Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/chsh -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-priv_change

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:718
      Result:error
      Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - chsh
      Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of chsh is enabled.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (All child checks must be true.)
          • error (audit augenrules chsh)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (audit augenrules)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl chsh)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:719 (textfilecontent54_test)

      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/chsh[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the mount command and syscall.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204552r833148_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030740
      Identities:CCE-27447-2
      V-72171
      SV-86795
      CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

      At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged mount commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

      When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "mount" command and syscall occur.

      Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S mount -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount
      -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S mount -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount
      -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/mount -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:686
      Result:error
      Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the mount command and syscall.
      Description:Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is no possible if audit records do not contain enough information. At a minimum, the orginization must audit the full-text recording of privileged mount commands. The orginization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (All child checks must be true.)
          • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • error (audit augenrules /bin/mount)
            • error (audit augenrules /usr/bin/mount)
          • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • error (audit augenrules mount 64-bit)
            • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
              • false (All child checks must be true.)
                • false (64 bit architecture)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                • false (64 bit architecture)
                • false (64 bit architecture)
          • error (audit augenrules mount 32-bit)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (audit augenrules)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl /bin/mount)
            • false (audit auditctl /usr/bin/mount)
          • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl mount 64-bit)
            • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
              • false (All child checks must be true.)
                • false (64 bit architecture)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                • false (64 bit architecture)
                • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (audit auditctl mount 32-bit)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:68600 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:error
      Title:audit augenrules /bin/mount
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:68600 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+(?:(\-F[\s]+path=\/bin\/mount[\s]+))(-F\s+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)\s+)?(?:-F\s+auid>=1000\s+\-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)\s+)(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:68601 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:error
      Title:audit augenrules /usr/bin/mount
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.

      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+(\-F\s+arch=b32\s+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+mount[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])mount([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000\s+\-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)\s+)(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:audit auditctl
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the umount command.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204553r833151_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030750
      Identities:CCE-80405-4
      V-72173
      SV-86797
      CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

      At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged mount commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

      When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "umount" command occur.

      Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/umount -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:757
      Result:error
      Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - umount
      Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of umount is enabled.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (All child checks must be true.)
          • error (audit augenrules umount)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (audit augenrules)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl umount)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:758 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:error
      Title:audit augenrules umount
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2586 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=(\/usr)?\/bin\/umount[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:audit augenrules
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ not evaluated ]
      • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
      • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
      • filename equals 'auditd.service'
      • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
      • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
      • subexpression does not exist
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:759 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:audit auditctl umount
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2587 (textfilecontent54_object)

      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=(\/usr)?\/bin\/umount[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:audit auditctl
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the ssh-keysign command.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204556r833160_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030780
      Identities:CCE-80408-8
      SV-86803
      V-72179
      CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

      At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged ssh commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

      When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "ssh-keysign" command occur.

      Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -a always,exit -F path=/usr/libexec/openssh/ssh-keysign -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-ssh

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the crontab command.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204557r833163_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030800
      Identities:CCE-80410-4
      SV-86807
      V-72183
      CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
      Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

      At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

      When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "crontab" command occur.

      Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/crontab -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-cron

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899

      Result:error
      Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - crontab
      Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of crontab is enabled.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (All child checks must be true.)
          • error (audit augenrules crontab)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (audit augenrules)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl crontab)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl)

      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2562 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/crontab[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the pam_timestamp_check command.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204558r833166_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030810
      Identities:CCE-80411-2
      V-72185
      SV-86809
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

      When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "pam_timestamp_check" command occur.

      Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/pam_timestamp_check -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-pam

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the create_module syscall.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204559r833169_rule
      Result:Error
      Version:RHEL-07-030819
      Identities:V-78999
      SV-93705
      CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
      Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

      Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216, SRG-OS-000477-GPOS-00222 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "create_module" syscall occur.

      Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

      -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S create_module -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k module-change

      -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S create_module -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k module-change

      The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:93705
      Result:error

        • error (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • error (audit augenrules 64-bit create_module)
            • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
              • false (All child checks must be true.)
                • false (64 bit architecture)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                • false (64 bit architecture)
                • false (64 bit architecture)
          • error (audit augenrules 32-bit create_module)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (audit augenrules)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl 64-bit create_module)
            • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
              • false (All child checks must be true.)
                • false (64 bit architecture)
              • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                • false (64 bit architecture)
                • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (audit auditctl 32-bit create_module)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (audit auditctl)
