      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not permit Generic Security Service Application Program Interface (GSSAPI) authentication unless needed.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204598r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-040430
      Identities:V-72259
      SV-86883
      CCI-000318 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-3 e; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-3.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-3 f; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-3 f)
      CCI-000368 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 c; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 c)
      CCI-001812 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-11 (2))
      CCI-001813 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-5 (1) (a))
      CCI-001814 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1))
      Description: GSSAPI authentication is used to provide additional authentication mechanisms to applications. Allowing GSSAPI authentication through SSH exposes the system's GSSAPI to remote hosts, increasing the attack surface of the system. GSSAPI authentication must be disabled unless needed. false
      Fix Text:Uncomment the "GSSAPIAuthentication" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor) and set the value to "no":

      GSSAPIAuthentication no

      The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.

      If GSSAPI authentication is required, it must be documented, to include the location of the configuration file, with the ISSO.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:160
      Result:true
      Title:Disable GSSAPI Authentication
      Description:Unless needed, disable the GSSAPI authentication option for the SSH Server.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (tests the value of GSSAPIAuthentication setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (package openssh-server is removed)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:161 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:tests the value of GSSAPIAuthentication setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2099 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)GSSAPIAuthentication(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8688300 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'no'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ false ]
      • filepath equals '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
      • path equals '/etc/ssh'
      • filename equals 'sshd_config'
      • pattern equals '^[\s]*(?i)GSSAPIAuthentication(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'GSSAPIAuthentication yes'
      • line equals 'GSSAPIAuthentication yes'
      • subexpression equals 'yes'
      Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
      subexpression
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
      Result:true
      Title:package openssh-server is removed
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not permit Kerberos authentication unless needed.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204599r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-040440
      Identities:CCE-80221-5
      V-72261
      SV-86885
      CCI-000318 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-3 e; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-3.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-3 f; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-3 f)
      CCI-000368 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 c; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 c)
      CCI-001812 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-11 (2))
      CCI-001813 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-5 (1) (a))
      CCI-001814 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1))
      Description: Kerberos authentication for SSH is often implemented using Generic Security Service Application Program Interface (GSSAPI). If Kerberos is enabled through SSH, the SSH daemon provides a means of access to the system's Kerberos implementation. Vulnerabilities in the system's Kerberos implementation may then be subject to exploitation. To reduce the attack surface of the system, the Kerberos authentication mechanism within SSH must be disabled for systems not using this capability. false
      Fix Text:Uncomment the "KerberosAuthentication" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor) and set the value to "no":

      KerberosAuthentication no

      The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.

      If Kerberos authentication is required, it must be documented, to include the location of the configuration file, with the ISSO.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:162
      Result:true
      Title:Disable Kerberos Authentication
      Description:Unless needed, disable the Kerberos authentication option for the SSH Server.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (tests the value of KerberosAuthentication setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (package openssh-server is removed)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:163 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:tests the value of KerberosAuthentication setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2100 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)KerberosAuthentication(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8688500 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'no'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
      Result:true
      Title:package openssh-server is removed
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon performs strict mode checking of home directory configuration files.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204600r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-040450
      Identities:CCE-80222-3
      SV-86887
      V-72263
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: If other users have access to modify user-specific SSH configuration files, they may be able to log on to the system as another user. false
      Fix Text:Uncomment the "StrictModes" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor) and set the value to "yes":

      StrictModes yes

      The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0

        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (package openssh-server is removed)

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon uses privilege separation.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204601r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-040460
      Identities:CCE-80223-1
      SV-86889
      V-72265
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: SSH daemon privilege separation causes the SSH process to drop root privileges when not needed, which would decrease the impact of software vulnerabilities in the unprivileged section. false
      Fix Text:Uncomment the "UsePrivilegeSeparation" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor) and set the value to "sandbox" or "yes":

      UsePrivilegeSeparation sandbox

      The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:171
      Result:true
      Title:Use Privilege Separation
      Description:Use privilege separation to cause the SSH process to drop root privileges when not needed.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (tests the value of UsePrivilegeSeparation setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (package openssh-server is removed)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:172 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:tests the value of UsePrivilegeSeparation setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2105 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)UsePrivilegeSeparation(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8688900 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'sandbox'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8688901 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'yes'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
      Result:true
      Title:package openssh-server is removed
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the SSH daemon does not allow compression or only allows compression after successful authentication.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204602r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-040470
      Identities:SV-86891
      V-72267
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: If compression is allowed in an SSH connection prior to authentication, vulnerabilities in the compression software could result in compromise of the system from an unauthenticated connection, potentially with root privileges. false
      Fix Text:Uncomment the "Compression" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor) on the system and set the value to "delayed" or "no":

      Compression no

      The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:158
      Result:true
      Title:Disable Compression Or Set Compression to delayed
      Description:SSH should either have compression disabled or set to delayed.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (tests the value of Compression setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (package openssh-server is removed)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:159 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:tests the value of Compression setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2098 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(?i)Compression(?-i)[\s]+(\w+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8689100 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(no|delayed)$'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
      Result:true
      Title:package openssh-server is removed
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon logon.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204605r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-040530
      Identities:SV-86899
      V-72275
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: Providing users with feedback on when account accesses last occurred facilitates user recognition and reporting of unauthorized account use. false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to provide users with feedback on when account accesses last occurred by setting the required configuration options in "/etc/pam.d/postlogin".

      Add the following line to the top of "/etc/pam.d/postlogin":

      session required pam_lastlog.so showfailed
      Severity:low
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1020
      Result:false
      Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon logon.
      Description:Providing users with feedback on when account accesses last occurred facilitates user recognition and reporting of unauthorized account use.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (Check the pam_lastlog configuration of /etc/pam.d/postlogin for the silent option)
        • false (Check the pam_lastlog configuration of /etc/pam.d/postlogin for the showfailed option)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1021 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:Check the pam_lastlog configuration of /etc/pam.d/postlogin for the silent option
      Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
      Check:No collected item may match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2791 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/pam.d'
      • filename must be equal to 'postlogin'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*[^\s#]+[ \t]+[\[\]\w=]+[ \t]+pam_lastlog\.so[ \t]+([\S \t]+)\s*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8689900 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^silent[\s]|[\s]silent[\s]|[\s]silent$|^silent$'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ false ]
      • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/postlogin'
      • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
      • filename equals 'postlogin'
      • pattern equals '^[\s]*[^\s#]+[ \t]+[\[\]\w=]+[ \t]+pam_lastlog\.so[ \t]+([\S \t]+)\s*$'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'session [default=1] pam_lastlog.so nowtmp showfailed'
      • line equals 'session [default=1] pam_lastlog.so nowtmp showfailed'
      • subexpression equals 'nowtmp showfailed'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ true ]
      • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/postlogin'
      • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
      • filename equals 'postlogin'
      • pattern equals '^[\s]*[^\s#]+[ \t]+[\[\]\w=]+[ \t]+pam_lastlog\.so[ \t]+([\S \t]+)\s*$'
      • instance equals '2'
      • text equals 'session optional pam_lastlog.so silent noupdate showfailed '
      • line equals 'session optional pam_lastlog.so silent noupdate showfailed '
      • subexpression equals 'silent noupdate showfailed'
      Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
      subexpression
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8689900 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:Check the pam_lastlog configuration of /etc/pam.d/postlogin for the showfailed option
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8689900 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/pam.d'
      • filename must be equal to 'postlogin'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*session[ \t]+required[ \t]+pam_lastlog\.so[ \t]+([\S \t]+)\s*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8689901 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^showfailed[\s]|[\s]showfailed[\s]|[\s]showfailed$|^showfailed$'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not contain .shosts files.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204606r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-040540
      Identities:SV-86901
      V-72277
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: The .shosts files are used to configure host-based authentication for individual users or the system via SSH. Host-based authentication is not sufficient for preventing unauthorized access to the system, as it does not require interactive identification and authentication of a connection request, or for the use of two-factor authentication. false
      Fix Text:Remove any found ".shosts" files from the system.

      # rm /[path]/[to]/[file]/.shosts
      Severity:high
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:86901
      Result:true
      Title:There must be no .shosts files on the system.
      Description:There must be no .shosts files on the system.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (There must be no .shosts files on the system.)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8690100 (file_test)
      Result:true
      Title:There must be no .shosts files on the system.
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8690100 (file_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • behavior requirements:
        • recurse = directories
        • recurse_direction = down
        • recurse_file_system = local
      • path must be equal to '/'
      • filename must be equal to '.shosts'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not contain shosts.equiv files.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204607r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-040550
      Identities:SV-86903
      V-72279
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: The shosts.equiv files are used to configure host-based authentication for the system via SSH. Host-based authentication is not sufficient for preventing unauthorized access to the system, as it does not require interactive identification and authentication of a connection request, or for the use of two-factor authentication. false

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not forward Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) source-routed packets.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204609r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-040610
      Identities:CCE-27434-0
      V-72283
      SV-86907
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when IPv4 forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router. false
      Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

      net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0

      Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

      # sysctl -system
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:251
      Result:false
      Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
      Description:The "net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration)
          • error (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • error (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route set to the appropriate value)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:355 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2226 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sysctl.conf'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*net\.ipv4\.conf\.all\.accept_source_route[\s]*=[\s]*(\d+)\s*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2227 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • for check = 'all', subexpression, the following must be true:
        • subexpression must be equal to '0'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:356 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:error
      Title:net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2228 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/sysctl.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*net\.ipv4\.conf\.all\.accept_source_route[\s]*=[\s]*(\d+)\s*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2227 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • for check = 'all', subexpression, the following must be true:
        • subexpression must be equal to '0'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:357 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2229 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/run/sysctl.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*net\.ipv4\.conf\.all\.accept_source_route[\s]*=[\s]*(\d+)\s*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

        • subexpression must be equal to '0'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not forward Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) source-routed packets by default.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204612r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-040620
      Identities:CCE-80162-1
      V-72285
      SV-86909
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when IPv4 forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router. false
      Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

      net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route = 0

      Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

      # sysctl --system
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:269
      Result:false
      Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
      Description:The "net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route static configuration)
          • error (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • error (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route set to the appropriate value)

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not respond to Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) echoes sent to a broadcast address.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204613r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-040630
      Identities:CCE-80165-4
      V-72287
      SV-86911
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: Responding to broadcast (ICMP) echoes facilitates network mapping and provides a vector for amplification attacks. false
      Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

      net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts = 1

      Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

      # sysctl --system
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:284
      Result:false
      Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
      Description:The "net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts static configuration)

          • false (net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • error (net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts set to the appropriate value)

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages from being accepted.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204614r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-040640
      Identities:CCE-80163-9
      SV-86913
      V-72289
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages modify the host's route table and are unauthenticated. An illicit ICMP redirect message could result in a man-in-the-middle attack. false
      Fix Text:Set the system to not accept IPv4 ICMP redirect messages by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

      net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects = 0

      Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

      # sysctl --system
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:266
      Result:false
      Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
      Description:The "net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects static configuration)
          • error (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects static configuration in /run/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • error (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects static configuration in /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects set to the appropriate value)

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must ignore Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204615r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-040641
      Identities:CCE-80158-9
      SV-87827
      V-73175
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages modify the host's route table and are unauthenticated. An illicit ICMP redirect message could result in a man-in-the-middle attack. false
      Fix Text:Set the system to ignore IPv4 ICMP redirect messages by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

      net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects = 0

      Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

      # sysctl --system
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:

      Result:false
      Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
      Description:The "net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects static configuration)
          • error (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • error (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects set to the appropriate value)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:351 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects static configuration
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2221 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sysctl.conf'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*net\.ipv4\.conf\.all\.accept_redirects[\s]*=[\s]*(\d+)\s*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2222 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow interfaces to perform Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects by default.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204616r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-040650
      Identities:CCE-80156-3
      V-72291
      SV-86915
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages contain information from the system's route table, possibly revealing portions of the network topology. false
      Fix Text:Configure the system to not allow interfaces to perform IPv4 ICMP redirects by default.

      Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

      net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects = 0

      Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

      # sysctl --system
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:281
      Result:false
      Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
      Description:The "net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration)
          • error (net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • error (net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects set to 0)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:395 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2275 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sysctl.conf'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*net\.ipv4\.conf\.default\.send_redirects[\s]*=[\s]*0[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:396 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:error
      Title:net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2276 (textfilecontent54_object)

      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*net\.ipv4\.conf\.default\.send_redirects[\s]*=[\s]*0[\s]*$'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:397 (textfilecontent54_test)

      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2277 (textfilecontent54_object)

      • path must be equal to '/run/sysctl.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*net\.ipv4\.conf\.default\.send_redirects[\s]*=[\s]*0[\s]*$'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not send Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects.

      Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages contain information from the system's route table, possibly revealing portions of the network topology. false
      Fix Text:Configure the system to not allow interfaces to perform IPv4 ICMP redirects.

      Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

      net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects = 0

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have a File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server package installed unless needed.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204620r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-040690
      Identities:SV-86923
      V-72299
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: The FTP service provides an unencrypted remote access that does not provide for the confidentiality and integrity of user passwords or the remote session. If a privileged user were to log on using this service, the privileged user password could be compromised. SSH or other encrypted file transfer methods must be used in place of this service. false
      Fix Text:Document the "vsftpd" package with the ISSO as an operational requirement or remove it from the system with the following command:

      # yum remove vsftpd
      Severity:high
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1301
      Result:true
      Title:Package vsftpd Removed
      Description:The RPM package vsftpd should be removed.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (package vsftpd is removed)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1302 (rpminfo_test)
      Result:true
      Title:package vsftpd is removed
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3012 (rpminfo_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • name must be equal to 'vsftpd'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have the Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) server package installed if not required for operational support.

      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-040700
      Identities:CCE-80213-2
      SV-86925
      V-72301

      CCI-000368 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 c; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 c)
      CCI-001812 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-11 (2))
      CCI-001813 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-5 (1) (a))
      CCI-001814 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1))
      Description: If TFTP is required for operational support (such as the transmission of router configurations) its use must be documented with the Information System Security Officer (ISSO), restricted to only authorized personnel, and have access control rules established. false
      Fix Text:Remove the TFTP package from the system with the following command:

      # yum remove tftp-server

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that remote X connections are disabled except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204622r603849_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-040710
      Identities:CCE-80226-4
      SV-86927
      V-72303
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: The security risk of using X11 forwarding is that the client's X11 display server may be exposed to attack when the SSH client requests forwarding. A system administrator may have a stance in which they want to protect clients that may expose themselves to attack by unwittingly requesting X11 forwarding, which can warrant a ''no'' setting.
      X11 forwarding should be enabled with caution. Users with the ability to bypass file permissions on the remote host (for the user's X11 authorization database) can access the local X11 display through the forwarded connection. An attacker may then be able to perform activities such as keystroke monitoring if the ForwardX11Trusted option is also enabled.
      If X11 services are not required for the system's intended function, they should be disabled or restricted as appropriate to the systems needs. false
      Fix Text:Edit the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file to uncomment or add the line for the "X11Forwarding" keyword and set its value to "no" (this file may be named differently or be in a different location if using a version of SSH that is provided by a third-party vendor):

      X11Forwarding no

      The SSH service must be restarted for changes to take effect:

      # systemctl restart sshd
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1389
      Result:true
      Title:RHEL-07-040710 - Disable X11 Forwarding
      Description:Open X displays allow an attacker to capture keystrokes and execute commands remotely.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (tests the value of X11Forwarding setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (package openssh-server is removed)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1390 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:tests the value of X11Forwarding setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3068 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • behavior requirements:
        • ignore_case = true
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*X11Forwarding[ \t]+([^\s#]*)[ \t]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:138900 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(no|"no")$'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ false ]
      • filepath equals '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
      • path equals '/etc/ssh'
      • filename equals 'sshd_config'
      • pattern equals '^[\s]*X11Forwarding[ \t]+([^\s#]*)[ \t]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
      • instance equals '1'
      • text equals 'X11Forwarding yes'
      • line equals 'X11Forwarding yes'
      • subexpression equals 'yes'
      Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
      subexpression
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1269 (rpminfo_test)
      Result:true
      Title:package openssh-server is removed
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2994 (rpminfo_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not have a graphical display manager installed unless approved.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204624r646847_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-040730
      Identities:CCE-27218-7
      SV-86931
      V-72307
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: Internet services that are not required for system or application processes must not be active to decrease the attack surface of the system. Graphical display managers have a long history of security vulnerabilities and must not be used unless approved and documented. false
      Fix Text:Document the requirement for a graphical user interface with the ISSO or reinstall the operating system without the graphical user interface. If reinstallation is not feasible, then continue with the following procedure:

      Open an SSH session and enter the following commands:

      $ sudo systemctl set-default multi-user.target

      $ sudo yum remove xorg-x11-server-Xorg xorg-x11-server-common xorg-x11-server-utils

      A reboot is required for the changes to take effect.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1305
      Result:true
      Title:Package xorg-x11-server-common Removed
      Description:The RPM package xorg-x11-server-common should be removed.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (package xorg-x11-server-common is removed)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1306 (rpminfo_test)
      Result:true
      Title:package xorg-x11-server-common is removed
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3014 (rpminfo_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • name must be equal to 'xorg-x11-server-common'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not be performing packet forwarding unless the system is a router.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204625r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-040740
      Identities:CCE-80157-1
      SV-86933
      V-72309
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: Routing protocol daemons are typically used on routers to exchange network topology information with other routers. If this software is used when not required, system network information may be unnecessarily transmitted across the network. false
      Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

      net.ipv4.ip_forward = 0

      Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

      # sysctl --system
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:290
      Result:false
      Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.ip_forward" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
      Description:The "net.ipv4.ip_forward" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (net.ipv4.ip_forward static configuration)
          • error (net.ipv4.ip_forward static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • false (net.ipv4.ip_forward static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • error (net.ipv4.ip_forward static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.ip_forward set to 0)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:407 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:net.ipv4.ip_forward static configuration
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2289 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sysctl.conf'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*net\.ipv4\.ip_forward[\s]*=[\s]*0[\s]*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:408 (textfilecontent54_test)

      Check:Result is based on check existence only.

      • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*net\.ipv4\.ip_forward[\s]*=[\s]*0[\s]*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2291 (textfilecontent54_object)

      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.

      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:334 (sysctl_test)
      Result:false
      Title:kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.ip_forward set to 0
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

      Object Requirements:
      • name must be equal to 'net.ipv4.ip_forward'

      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      SNMP community strings on the Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be changed from the default.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204627r603261_rule
      Result:Pass
      Version:RHEL-07-040800
      Identities:CCE-27386-2
      SV-86937
      V-72313
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: Whether active or not, default Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) community strings must be changed to maintain security. If the service is running with the default authenticators, anyone can gather data about the system and the network and use the information to potentially compromise the integrity of the system or network(s). It is highly recommended that SNMP version 3 user authentication and message encryption be used in place of the version 2 community strings. false
      Fix Text:If the "/etc/snmp/snmpd.conf" file exists, modify any lines that contain a community string value of "public" or "private" to another string value.
      Severity:high
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1369
      Result:true
      Title:SNMP default communities disabled
      Description:SNMP default communities must be removed.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true (Check snmpd configuration)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (package net-snmp is removed)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1370 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:true
      Title:Check snmpd configuration
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3058 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • behavior requirements:
        • ignore_case = true
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/snmp/snmpd.conf'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*(com2se|rocommunity|rwcommunity|createUser|authcommunity)[^#]*(public|private)'
      • instance must be equal to '1'
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1265 (rpminfo_test)
      Result:true
      Title:package net-snmp is removed
      Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2991 (rpminfo_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • name must be equal to 'net-snmp'

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not forward IPv6 source-routed packets.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204630r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-040830
      Identities:CCE-80179-5
      V-72319
      SV-86943
      CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
      Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when IPv6 forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router. false
      Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter, if IPv6 is enabled, by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

      net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0

      Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

      # sysctl --system
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:303
      Result:false
      Title:Kernel "net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
      Description:The "net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration)
            • error (net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
            • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
            • error (net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route set to the appropriate value)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 static configuration)
              • error (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
              • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
              • error (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set to 1)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (ipv6.disable=1 in /proc/cmdline)
            • false (ipv6.disable=1 in grub.cfg)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:423 (textfilecontent54_test)

      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2309 (textfilecontent54_state)

        • subexpression must be equal to '0'

      • text equals ' linux16 /boot/vmlinuz-3.10.0-1160.el7.x86_64 root=UUID=9cff3d69-3769-4ad9-8460-9c54050583f9 ro console=tty0 console=ttyS0,115200n8 crashkernel=auto net.ifnames=0 console=ttyS0 LANG=en_US.UTF-8'
      • line equals ' linux16 /boot/vmlinuz-3.10.0-1160.el7.x86_64 root=UUID=9cff3d69-3769-4ad9-8460-9c54050583f9 ro console=tty0 console=ttyS0,115200n8 crashkernel=auto net.ifnames=0 console=ttyS0 LANG=en_US.UTF-8'
      • subexpression equals '-3.10.0-1160.el7.x86_64 root=UUID=9cff3d69-3769-4ad9-8460-9c54050583f9 ro console=tty0 console=ttyS0,115200n8 crashkernel=auto net.ifnames=0 console=ttyS0 LANG=en_US.UTF-8'
      Collected Item/State Result:
      [ false ]
      • filepath equals '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
      • path equals '/boot/grub2'
      • filename equals 'grub.cfg'
      • pattern equals '^\s*linux(?:[^#\n]*)/vmlinuz([^#\n]*)'
      • instance equals '5'
      • text equals ' linux16 /boot/vmlinuz-0-rescue-cc2c86fe566741e6a2ff6d399c5d5daa root=UUID=9cff3d69-3769-4ad9-8460-9c54050583f9 ro console=tty0 console=ttyS0,115200n8 crashkernel=auto net.ifnames=0 console=ttyS0'
      • line equals ' linux16 /boot/vmlinuz-0-rescue-cc2c86fe566741e6a2ff6d399c5d5daa root=UUID=9cff3d69-3769-4ad9-8460-9c54050583f9 ro console=tty0 console=ttyS0,115200n8 crashkernel=auto net.ifnames=0 console=ttyS0'
      • subexpression equals '-0-rescue-cc2c86fe566741e6a2ff6d399c5d5daa root=UUID=9cff3d69-3769-4ad9-8460-9c54050583f9 ro console=tty0 console=ttyS0,115200n8 crashkernel=auto net.ifnames=0 console=ttyS0'

      subexpression

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must have the required packages for multifactor authentication installed.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204631r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-041001
      Identities:SV-87041
      V-72417
      CCI-001948 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (11))
      CCI-001953 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
      CCI-001954 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
      Description: Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device.

      Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card.

      A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user.

      Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless.

      This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00160, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00161, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00162 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to implement multifactor authentication by installing the required packages.

      Install the pam_pkcs11 package with the following command:

      # yum install pam_pkcs11
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:87041
      Result:false
      Title:The operating system must have the required packages for multifactor authentication installed.
      Description:The operating system must have the required packages for multifactor authentication installed.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (package 'pam_pkcs11' is installed)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8704101 (rpminfo_test)
      Result:false
      Title:package 'pam_pkcs11' is installed
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8704101 (rpminfo_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • name must be equal to 'pam_pkcs11'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement multifactor authentication for access to privileged accounts via pluggable authentication modules (PAM).

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204632r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-041002
      Identities:CCE-80437-7
      V-72427
      SV-87051
      CCI-001948 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (11))
      CCI-001953 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
      CCI-001954 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
      Description: Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device.

      Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card.

      A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user.

      Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless.

      This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00160, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00161, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00162 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to implement multifactor authentication for remote access to privileged accounts via pluggable authentication modules (PAM).

      Modify all of the services lines in "/etc/sssd/sssd.conf" or in configuration files found under "/etc/sssd/conf.d" to include pam.
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1405
      Result:false
      Title:Configure PAM in SSSD Services
      Description:SSSD should be configured to run SSSD PAM services.
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (check if pam is configured in the services setting of the sssd section)
        • false (check if pam is configured in the services setting of a conf file in the sssd conf.d directory)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1406 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:check if pam is configured in the services setting of the sssd section
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3081 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sssd/sssd.conf'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*\[sssd\]([^\n]*\n+)+?[\s]*services.*pam.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:140601 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:check if pam is configured in the services setting of a conf file in the sssd conf.d directory
      Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
      Check:Result is based on check existence only.
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:140601 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • path must be equal to '/etc/sssd/conf.d'
      • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*\[sssd\]([^\n]*\n+)+?[\s]*services.*pam.*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

      The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement certificate status checking for PKI authentication.

      Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204633r603261_rule
      Result:Fail
      Version:RHEL-07-041003
      Identities:V-72433
      SV-87057
      CCI-001948 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (11))
      CCI-001953 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
      CCI-001954 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
      Description: Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device.

      Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card.

      A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user.

      Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless.

      This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).

      Satisfies: SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00160, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00161, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00162 false
      Fix Text:Configure the operating system to do certificate status checking for PKI authentication.

      Modify all of the "cert_policy" lines in "/etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf" to include "ocsp_on".
      Severity:medium
      Weight:10.0
      Reference:
      Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Publisher:DISA
      Type:DPMS Target
      Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
      Identifier:2899
      Definitions:
      Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:87057
      Result:false
      Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement certificate status checking for PKI authentication.
      Description:Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device. Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card. A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user. Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless. This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).
      Class:compliance
      Tests:
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (Check all cert_policy entries are set with the ocsp_on option in /etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf)
        • false (Check cert_policy is set with the ocsp_on option 3 or more times in /etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf)
      Tests:
      Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8705700 (textfilecontent54_test)
      Result:false
      Title:Check all cert_policy entries are set with the ocsp_on option in /etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf
      Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
      Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
      Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8705700 (textfilecontent54_object)
      Object Requirements:
      • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf'
      • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*cert_policy[ \t]+=[ \t]+([\w\,"' ]+);\s*$'
      • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
      State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8705700 (textfilecontent54_state)
      State Requirements:
      • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^["']*ocsp_on["']*$|^["']*ocsp_on["',\s]|["',\s]ocsp_on["',\s]|["',\s]ocsp_on["']*$'

      Check:Result is based on check existence only.

      • instance must be greater than or equal to '3'
